-1.title: Catch My Drift?
-1.plot: The guys land a custom drift car and a luxury antiques unit that could have a one-of-a-kind pilot pistol from WWI. While trying to track down the provenance of the gun, Ton's lead foot gets them into trouble at their car sale.

1.title: The Wild West
1.plot: Ton and Allen head to auctions in the desert town of San Bernardino. Ton scores a deadly 1800s British Pepperbox handgun and tests it at the gun range. Allen wins a unit for a $1 and finds a fully functional pre-WWI train set.

2.title: The Big Score
2.plot: The business of storage unit auctions has emerged as a thriving trade for many, including Allen Haff & Ton Jones. Ton and Allen bid on units in downtown LA and uncover a '70s German H&K P7 pistol and a rare copper cash register.

3.title: Ton's Got a Gun
3.plot: The guys enter a high-stakes bidding war with Allen's old rivals. Ton and Allen uncover a depression-era "Art Case" slot machine, a custom mini-bike and a Wild West 1880s Colt Peacemaker, but can they turn a profit?

4.title: Strat'ed for Cash
4.plot: Ton and Allen stake out a high-end storage auction. They uncover a Maui Blue '70s Fender Stratocaster and a rare 1936 jet-inspired Schwinn, but will this rusty ride rake in the riches?

5.title: The Real Thing
5.plot: First upright coin-operated Coke vending machine, a classic GMC truck with a chromed engine.

6.title: Weapons of Past Destruction
6.plot: Civil War era black powder muskets, 19th century Masonic secret ceremonial swords, a WWII Japanese samurai blade, and a "Nixon-Era" polygraph machine.

7.title: Gangster Whiskey
7.plot: The first ever model CD player, a classic 1951 record jukebox, a rare Willie Mays baseball card, 1920s Prohibition whiskey and a moonshine still.

8.title: Home on the Gun Range
8.plot: A vintage 1940s Kiss-O-Meter penny arcade game, a 1901 Winchester Shotgun and an antique crossbow.

1.title: Miami Heat
1.plot: All-terrain Air Commander Hovercraft, a 1970s NASA countdown clock and a one-of-a-kind 1960s Delta Relay rocket.

2.title: Quadzilla Attacks
2.plot: Extreme Quadzilla ATV, the fastest 4 wheeler ever; a 1910s Remington Derringer and an 1880s Palm Squeezer pistol; revolutionary 1800s Western Electric telephone with a crank dial.

3.title: Sink or Swim
3.plot: 1905 Hand-crank Thomas Edison gramophone with cylindrical records; a discontinued Addictor 190 Mini Boat; a rare 1897 Regina music box.

4.title: Disco and Dice
4.plot: 1978 Williams Disco pinball machine; 1898 dice popper gambling device; talking 1990s bar top breathalyzer; deadly fishing harpoon

5.title: Labor of Love
5.plot: Harley Davidson V-twin EVO engine and revolutionary 1958 dual-suspension swingarm frame; '80s Ms. Pac-Man arcade machine; rare Air Jordan vintage shoe collection in mint condition.

6.title: The Chicago Grand Slam
6.plot: 1984 Yamaha SS440 Snowmobile that introduced the revolutionary shock absorber suspension; rare autographed 1920s baseball glove; mint Hank Aaron signed baseball; authentic 1950s Robby the Robot collector toy

7.title: The Chi-Town Showdown
7.plot: Metal Victorian-era burial casket; 1870s glass fire extinguisher grenades; a mechanical 1896 handcrafted Chicago fire station alarm box

8.title: Fire in the Hole!
8.plot: 1930s "blasting machine" dynamite detonator box; 1890s treasure chest with secret compartments. Ton smelts jewelry to forge bricks of silver.

9.title: Animal Instincts
9.plot: The first pump action shotgun - a Winchester Model 1897; a hunter's collection of prize big game, full-body taxidermy.

10.title: Everything's Bigger in Texas
10.plot: Winchester 1886 rifle invented to kill buffalo; collection of 1950s electric Slot Cars.

11.title: The Smoking Ton
11.plot: WW2 Stuart M3 tank barrel and heavy duty tank treads; rare, collectors' 1890 silver inlayed humidor; high-end industrial meat slicer in the ultimate restaurant unit

12.title: Top Gun Ton
12.plot: Allen and Ton head to Ontario, California, for a major auction and go head-to-head with some high rollers. The guys uncover a scale RC Viper FanJet aircraft with a powerful jet engine and a 1920s Gundlach Korona large format field camera.

13.title: Beantown Bidders
13.plot: 1800s blackpowder whaling harpoon; 1940s Schwinn Town & Country tandem bicycle; a vintage American flag collection that could be worth thousands.

14.title: Diesel Digs
14.plot: The guys head to the industrial hub of LA to score some heavy machinery and unearth a 1981 Bobcat 743 Frontloader, one of the first powered by a diesel engine and a trench-defending WWI German Sturmtrupp helmet bashing mace.

15.title: Dallas Mavericks
15.plot: Military-grade Tomahawk cruise missile jet engine; century-old handcrafted wild west cowboy saddle; 1960s high roller's gold money

16.title: Knuckle Dust
16.plot: The guys head to Hollywood to score it big and uncover an 1870s French Jarre Dolne Knuckle Duster revolver-knife-brass knuckle combo and a 1980 autographed Raging Bull movie poster.

17.title: Half Pipe Dreams
17.plot: 1970s Z-Flex Jimmy Plumer Poolrider skateboard with artwork by Doug Smith; Kevlar bulletproof vest, ballistic facemask and a helmet used by S.W.A.T. teams; a pair of 1990s racing pocket bikes capable of going 80 mph.

18.title: Viva Las Vegas
18.plot: 1974 death-defying Zig Zag magic sword box, an ultra-rare 1910 poster of the infamous magician Chung Ling Soo, an 1800s naval cane sword and century-old Metlach German beer steins

19.title: Rodeo Ton
19.plot: 1970s El Toro mechanical bull used to train bull riders; silver WWII era banjo; a collection of 1800s handcrafted hunting duck decoys

20.title: Sin City Shootout
20.plot: In a major Vegas auction, Allen and Ton take on some serious gamblers. The guys score a 1953 Chevy-inspired bumper car, a stash of M16 30-round magazines, and a set of homemade aerosol-powered spud gun potato launchers.

21.title: Night of the Digging Dead
21.plot: A custom-built shark cage; 1900s pathologist's dissection toolkit; 1940s embalming pump and one of the first electric bone saws.

22.title: Battle Bought
22.plot: Mint 1800s French "Harmonica Pistol" and a collection of '90s remote controlled combat robots.

23.title: Hot Wheels
23.plot: '70s sandrail dune racer with rally hemi heads; 1965 replica Mustang pool table; off-road racing gear

24.title: Great American Cashtime
24.plot: Allen and Ton head to San Diego and face off against a high roller. They discover a rare 1950s Master Pitch baseball machine and a 1980s Jaws of Life tool used by rescuers to pry open cars.

25.title: Auction Hunters, Ink.
25.plot: Autographed 1960s Bob Shaw Swing Gate tattoo machine; Terry Ives competition 22hp chainsaw; six foot chainsaw-carved cedar bear.

26.title: Reel Money
26.plot: Ton and Allen travel to a container auction in San Diego and encounter some reckless spenders. They discover a "laser tag" system used for military training and refurbish a 1970's-era Fighting Chair used for big-game fishing.

27.title: Early Bird Special
27.plot: Vintage Shooting Star carnival game; professional Mixed Martial Arts octagon fighting cage

0.title: Auction Hunters: Live
0.plot: In an unprecedented live event, Ton and Allen attend an exclusive high-end auction and attempt to turn a profit in just one hour! Watch as Ton and Allen race to dig the units they've won and sell their contents live!

1.title: Cold Hard Cash
1.plot: Ton and Allen go North to Alaska and get a cold reception from the local auctioneer. They find two enormous seaplane pontoons and a pair of Smith & Wesson revolvers, including the most powerful production handgun in the world!

2.title: Ton's Driller Instinct
2.plot: Ton & Allen encounter aggressive outdoorsmen in the Alaskan wilderness. The guys discover an 8-wheeled ATV that travels on both land & water and an air percussion hammer that can drill through solid rock!

3.title: Hidden Hot Wheels
3.plot: Ton and Allen challenge a big time auction buyer on his home turf. The guys uncover a 1969 Chevelle Malibu muscle car and a single-shot pistol designed to aid Allied resistance fighters during WWII.

4.title: Big Easy Money
4.plot: Allen & Ton head to New Orleans in search of easy money, but instead encounter some bayou bidders with big-time bucks! They discover a pair of early 19th-century dueling pistols & a vintage airboat fitted with a turbine engine!

5.title: Auction Hunter Shuffle
5.plot: Ton and Allen teach a cocky new auction hunter a lesson. They spot a 1940's-era shuffleboard table and uncover an early hot rod made from the fuel tank of a WWII fighter plane!

6.title: High Flying Ton
6.plot: A nerdy auction buyer tests Ton and Allen's patience at a big container auction in Ventura. The guys discover a basket and burners for a hot air balloon and a 19th century German single shot rifle!

7.title: Drumming Up Cash
7.plot: Ton & Allen face some silent but deadly competition at an auction in nearby Glendale. They discover a Zildjian brand percussion cymbal from the 1940's and a pyrotechnics control board designed for large-scale fireworks displays!

8.title: Bowling Pin Payday
8.plot: Allen & Ton visit Ton's old stompin' ground and go head-to-head with a trash-talking auction buyer. They uncover a 19th century rifle with a matching cutlass bayonet and a mechanical bowling pinsetter from the early 1960's!

9.title: Fake Punt Payoff
9.plot: Ton and Allen contend with a large crowd of inexperienced auction-buyers at a huge storage container auction in Pasadena. They find a small fleet of Segway personal transporters and an enormous custom-made shotgun.

10.title: Episode #3.10
10.plot: Ton & Allen attend a silent auction in NJ, but that doesn't stop the local buyers from letting them know they're not welcome! They uncover a skeet throwing machine from the 1960's & a vintage vehicle with some real horsepower!

11.title: Mr. Haff Goes to Washington
11.plot: Ton and Allen invade the Nation's capital, but meet strong resistance from local bidders. The guys uncover a Civil War era black powder revolver and a stash of South African gold coins!

12.title: Episode #3.12
12.plot: Ton & Allen attend a silent auction in NJ, but that doesn't stop the local buyers from letting them know they're not welcome! They uncover a skeet throwing machine from the 1960's & a vintage vehicle with some real horsepower!

13.title: Episode #3.13
13.plot: Ton & Allen face-off against an auction buyer with shady bidding tactics and even more questionable fashion sense. The guys find a custom-built monowheel & a rifle designed to ward off grave robbers in the early 19th century!

14.title: Plank Cannon/Calliope
14.plot: The guys head to Baton Rouge, LA and discover a 1900s - decade barber chair and a pair of racing lawnmowers.

15.title: Episode #3.15
15.plot: An unassuming mom in an oversized sweater tries to pull the wool over Ton & Allen's eyes at a storage auction in Arlington, VA. The guys uncover a black powder cannon designed in the 15th century & a Russian military motorcycle!

16.title: Sidecar Surprise
16.plot: The guys hope to make a big profit from a vintage military motorcycle and replica cannon.

17.title: Choo-Choo, Cha-Ching!
17.plot: Ton and Allen get a surprise second chance after nearly getting shut out in the small town of Palmer. They uncover a motorized railroad maintenance car from the 1960's and a pre-WWI Japanese semi-automatic pistol.

18.title: Episode #3.18
18.plot: Allen & Ton try to get the inside scoop on their competition by chatting up local auction buyers. The guys find some heavy gold-mining machinery from the 1950s & an amateur rocket that can travel faster than the speed of sound!

19.title: Episode #3.19
19.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

20.title: Ice, Ice, Baby
20.plot: Ton and Allen visit Colorado, and end up with a Zamboni in a storage unit. Auctioneer Rich Schur.

21.title: Gangs of New York
21.plot: Ton and Allen duke it out with a local thrift store gang at a Brooklyn storage auction. The guys discover a classic arcade redemption game and a mid-century water cannon designed to fight towering infernos!

22.title: Allen's Ruff Day
22.plot: Ton and Allen head to an auction in Ton's hometown and end up battling with a big-mouthed buyer. They discover a pair of tranquilizer dart guns and also end up fighting with a K9!

23.title: Ton's Hot Commodity
23.plot: Allen is late to the auction, leaving Ton to battle a feisty female auction buyer on his own! The guys find a fully functional flamethrower and a rare hand-carved bow and arrow set from South America!

24.title: Episode #3.24
24.plot: Ton and Allen have to get aggressive when they encounter a towering opponent with a mountain of cash. The guys uncover a vintage ice resurfacing machine and an Olympic biathalon rifle!

25.title: Money Makin' Monster Machines
25.plot: Ton and Allen duke it out with a local thrift store gang at a Brooklyn storage auction. The guys discover a classic arcade redemption game and a mid-century water cannon designed to fight towering infernos!

26.title: Episode #3.26
26.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

27.title: Hula Moola
27.plot: Ton and Allen jet to the Hawaiian islands where they're joined by a feisty new female assistant!The team uncovers a pair of James Bond-style gadgets designed for high-speed underwater travel and a vintage sled.

28.title: Friends in Hawaii Places
28.plot: Allen &Ton enlist an assistant, Carolyn, and Allen's Hawaiian buddy, Junior, to help them battle local buyers. The guys find a WWII-era motor scooter and a stash of antique Polynesian tattoo tools that get used on Ton!

29.title: Gold 'n' Gloves
29.plot: The Auction Hunters team goes on the attack & ends up on a collision course with a hardened veteran auction buyer. They uncover a collection of speedy off-road vehicles and some hardcore heavy metal from the turn-of the-century!

1.title: Once a Pawn a Time
1.plot: Ton and Allen discover that owning a pawn shop is way more trouble than they expected. With bills stacking up, even an antique ammo collection and some classic football helmets may not be enough to put the guys in the black.

2.title: Win Lose or Joust
2.plot: Ton and Allen race back from an auction to purchase a rare comic valued at over $100,000. The guys uncover a Samurai sword used for ritual suicide and Allen lives out his childhood fantasy of becoming knight.

3.title: It's Raining Ton
3.plot: The guys take Big Sis to her first auction - and when things get ugly, she becomes their secret weapon. Ton tests out a "blob" and Allen gets shot with a riot gun.

4.title: Rock-et to Me!
4.plot: Ton and Allen end up in a turf war at a Hollywood auction and at odds with each other over whether to gamble on what could be an antique slot machine. Allen attempts to fly a jetpack.

5.title: Off the Deep End
5.plot: Ton and Allen quarrel over bidding strategy at a rare auction on Catalina Island and must race against the clock to unload a one man submersible that could be worth big money... if they can make it work.

6.title: Trading Places
6.plot: When an injury sidelines Allen, he stays at the shop while Ton takes Big Sis to the auction and goes rogue, ignoring Allen's advice and making risky purchases that could lose the partners a boatload of cash.

7.title: Flying Ton, Creeping Allen
7.plot: When a group of thugs try to bully Ton and Allen out of a Chinatown auction, the guys fight back, leading to a violent showdown and the discovery of both a rare Bornean blowgun and special effects wire harnesses.

8.title: Whip It Good
8.plot: With a motocross bike and a rare stock whip up for grabs, Ton and Allen face one of their toughest competitors yet: their former employee Carolyn, who knows all their tricks, has money to burn and is out for revenge.

9.title: Machine Gun Ton
9.plot: Ton and Allen battle a pair of vicious female auction hunters who have an axe to grind and bid based on spite rather than strategy. And a gatling gun & suit of armor are worth much less than the guys expected.

10.title: Always Money in Philadelphia
10.plot: In Philadelphia, the guys face a shady bidder with inside information and former NFL star Vince Papale in a battle for a vintage football passing machine and a colonial musket that could be worth huge money... if it's real.

11.title: Carolyn Goes Topless
11.plot: Every day, thousands of abandoned storage units are put up for auction. Professional Auction Hunters Ton Jones and Allen Haff bring their quest for treasure to auctions across America and sell their incredible finds for big profits.

12.title: Don't Taze Me Bro
12.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

13.title: The Fall Guys
13.plot: Every day, thousands of abandoned storage units are put up for auction. Professional Auction Hunters Ton Jones and Allen Haff bring their quest for treasure to auctions across America and sell their incredible finds for big profits.

14.title: Separation Anxiety
14.plot: With Ton missing, Allen struggles to keep the pawn shop afloat while training Elle to work an auction. After a fierce bidding war with Caroline, pieces from a century old motorcycle may not be enough to save the day. ed.

15.title: Allen Vs. Ton
15.plot: Allen and Ton show up at an auction as enemies, but with a common foe and pro-go-karts on the line they may be forced to join forces.

16.title: You Got Served
16.plot: After a crushing defeat, the guys leave an auction empty handed and scramble to find new merchandise at a yard sale. But questionable antique tennis rackets and an ancient special effects box may not earn them a cent.

17.title: Without a Chute
17.plot: After a tough auction, things get worse when the shop's landlord wants to talk to the guys. Ton tries to negotiate with him while Allen has to put an experimental powered parachute to the test to save the day's profits.

20.title: Allen's Big Crush
20.plot: The guys battle it out with their fierce former-employee, while a shill bidder threatens to ruin the day. When all hope seems lost, a set of monster truck tires and a mystery box are their last chance to come out on top.

23.title: Cashville
23.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

2.title: Ramped Up
2.plot: Ton and Allen go head-to-head with their former assistant, Carolyn, while Ton battles a bad back. The guys discover an automatic BB gun and, when negotiations to sell a stunt ramp go south, Allen faces a tough decision.

17.title: Whiskey Business
17.plot: An auction in Allen's old stomping grounds triggers memories of being a "lone wolf." The guys find a set of RC race boats and when they buy a man-cave unit full of old whiskey, a night of partying leads to some tough sales.

20.title: Catch My Drift
20.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.title: Auction Hunters
plot: _Auction Hunters_ (qv), Allen Haff and Ton Jones, travel America bidding on unclaimed storage units they think will contain the most hidden treasure - worth big cash - the better the history the higher the price.::JW
